SUMMARY: SlyA (for hemolytic protein in Salmonella ) was initially identified in Salmonella, although little is known about regulator role of SlyA. It has been demonstrated that SlyA increases expression of hemolysin E by antagonizing negative effects of H-NS [10027972, 14996792]. SlyA belongs to MarR family of transcriptional regulators. This protein consist of two domains, an amino-terminal domain involved in dimerization and a carboxy-terminal domain indispensable for DNA recognition [12649270]. It is known that SlyA recognizes a short palindromic DNA sequence of 12 bp [14996792].
